headline: Data center firm Equinix expands in Brazil, sees it as a priority market, director says
summary: RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) -U.S. data center operator Equinix is expanding its operations in Brazil, which the firm sees as a priority market, its managing director for Latin America Eduardo Zago said on Thursday.  Equinix is one of the companies benefiting from the increased demand for data center infrastructure amid a surge in artificial intelligence usage.  Brazil has been seeking to become a sustainable infrastructure hub, given the country's abundant supply of renewable energy.

headline: Will Applied Digital's Pivot to AI Infrastructure Broaden Its Revenue Base?
summary: APLD deepens its AI pivot with new data centers and long-term leases, aiming to replace crypto-driven volatility.

headline: Prologis: Data Centers Could Meaningfully Accelerate Growth
summary: Prologis sees growth through rising logistics demand, rent upside, and expansion into high-margin data centers with solid fundamentals. See why PLD stock is a buy.
